subject: Navigating Uncertainty
body:
March 2025 Newsletter    |      
View this email in your browser
 
 
Dear friend,  
The times we are living in are deeply unsettling. As we approach the milestone of President Trump's first 100 days in office, many of our community members are feeling fear, worry, and overwhelm amid a whirlwind of executive orders and multiple reports of arbitrary green card and visa revocations.  The looming threat of a travel ban and troubling detainments of tourists and valid visa holders at airports have only intensified these anxieties. 
The recent ICE arrests and detainments of Mahmoud Khalil and Rumeysa Ozturk – and the attempted arrest of Yunseo Chung – are stark reminders that activists, organizers, and anyone speaking out could face similar consequences. With each new arbitrary arrest, the Trump administration is curtailing freedom of speech and violating the core tenets of our democracy. We must fight back against each new injustice and the rising tide of authoritarianism.
At Advancing Justice | Chicago, we are joining together with our allies to reject the Trump administration’s cruel agenda. Earlier this week, I stood alongside the Illinois Coalition for Immigrant and Refugee Rights in
 condemning the rumored travel ban
, which will restrict travel from more than 40 countries across Africa, Asia, and the Middle East. Our members will be joining a 
mass mobilization on April 5th
 to send a clear message that Chicagoans reject President Trump and Elon Musk’s attacks on our communities. And we continue to organize concerned community members to advocate for local policy change to strengthen immigrant rights in Illinois.
Join us in making Illinois welcoming for all by attending Asian American Action Day on April 30th! Every year, the Pan-Asian Voter Empowerment Coalition mobilizes 300 Asian American community members to flood the state capitol in Springfield and advocate for our shared legislative agenda. This year, our priorities include: 
Strengthening the Illinois TRUST Act, which prohibits collaboration between ICE and local police; 
Increasing funding for immigrant-serving organizations to provide language access, legal services, citizenship classes, and other critical services; 
Funding inclusive history implementation at the K-12 level; and 
Establishing a cultural and religious calendar for K-12 schools. 
As we transition into spring, I hope you can join us in taking action and find ways to stay resilient. Although the challenges we face may feel overwhelming, we can find strength in community and work together to get through these trying times. 
With gratitude, 
 
 
Grace Pai
Executive Director
Asian Americans Advancing Justice | Chicago
 
Newsletter at a glance:
 
Press Conference Condemning Rumored 
Travel Ban  
Remembering Tuyet Le
Save the Date: AAA Day! April 30th, 2025 
Partner with us for AAPI Heritage Month!
In the News
I Speak Power Updates
KINETIC Updates
A Just Chi Updates
Monthly Donor Raffle Winner!
 Chicago’s Immigrant Leaders Hold
Press Conference  
Ahead of the Anticipated Trump Travel Ban
 
Photo Credit: Max Herman/Borderless Magazine
On March 26, 2025, Advancing Justice | Chicago joined Chicago’s immigrant community leaders to address the escalating situation at airports across the country. Describing it as an effective travel ban, the leaders highlighted numerous reports that foreign nationals and permanent residents are being singled out, detained, denied entry, and deported to third countries against their will. Speaking at the press conference, Advancing Justice | Chicago’s executive director Grace Pai described these incidents as “authoritarian and unjust.” 
President Trump's leaked travel ban would restrict entry from 43 countries in the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The draft, which has not yet been officially enacted, would impose a near-total ban on travel from countries such as Afghanistan, Iran, and Syria, while heavily restricting travel from 32 other nations. Because more than half of all Asian Americans immigrated to the U.S. from another country, Asian Americans would be particularly impacted by the proposed travel ban. Not only would family members lose the ability to visit each other for weddings, graduations, and funerals, but countless family visa and employment visa applications would also be put on indefinite hold. 
The press conference received extensive media coverage, with 10 outlets present. Please visit our website to view all media coverage from the event.   
Chicago's Immigrant Leaders Rally Against Trump's Travel Ban Plans
Federal Plaza rally targets proposed Trump travel ban 2.0 | WGN-TV
 Remembering Tuyet Le
 
The Chicago Tribune published an obituary for former executive director of Advancing Justice | Chicago, 
Tuyet Le
, celebrating her life’s work and her enduring impact on the fight for immigrant rights. Though Tuyet is no longer with us, her legacy continues through the work she inspired at Advancing Justice | Chicago and in the hearts of those she touched.  
 
Save the Date: AAA Day!
April 30th, 2025
 
We are getting closer to the Pan-Asian Voter Empowerment (PAVE) Coalition’s 12th annual Asian American Action Day (AAA Day) on April 30th in Springfield, Illinois! 
The PAVE Coalition consists of 19 Asian American advocacy and direct service organizations in the Chicagoland area. Founded in 2011, the PAVE Coalition focuses on increasing voter turnout and civic participation among Asian Americans and improving the lives of Asian Americans through advocacy and policy change.  
In 2012, PAVE held the first Asian American Advocacy Day and launched the Asian American Caucus in Springfield. Policy is passed through stories. AAA Day gives us the opportunity to share our personal stories with elected officials and bring our demands to the forefront! 
 
We are excited to announce registration is now open to join us in Springfield! Please take a moment to use this 
link
 to join us. 
 
Partner with us for
AAPI Heritage Month!
Get ready to celebrate AAPI Heritage Month with us this May! Every year, Asian Americans Advancing Justice | Chicago partners with local restaurants, bars, shops, and businesses to bring awareness to and fundraise for our work.  
We are looking to use AAPI Heritage Month as a time for our community members and local businesses to come together, give back, and make a difference.  
 
Pictured Above: Chef Sherrie Tan speaks to attendees of the AANHPI Chef Collaboration Dinner. Hosted at BiXi Beer last year, proceeds from the dinner went to Advancing Justice | Chicago for AAPI Heritage Month. Other participating chefs included: Bo Fowler, Thai Dang, Margaret Pak, and Won Kim.  Photo credit: Kristen Mendiola
We invite local businesses based in Chicago and beyond to partner with Asian Americans Advancing Justice | Chicago this May. Businesses can participate in the following ways: 
 
Share a portion of proceeds from an item  
Host a small fundraising event 
Provide an in-kind donation 
Please help us expand our partnerships by: 
 
Referring any local business, you know to our partner pledge form below 
Attending AAPI Heritage Month fundraisers in May (be on the lookout for more information!) 
Patronizing the local businesses that are supporting us, once the list is announced! 
If you are a business interested in partnering with us this spring, please fill out our pledge form at 
bit.ly/HM25chi
 or click the button below by 
Monday, April 21st
. Please contact 
fundraising@advancingjustice-chicago.org
 if you have any questions. 
 
Heritage Month Partner Form
 
 In the News
 
Our Executive Director, Grace Pai, was featured on WBBM's weekly radio show, "At Issue," on Sunday, March 9th, 2025, to discuss the recent anti-immigrant executive orders and their impact on Asian American communities. 
Hosted by award-winning journalist Craig Dellimore, the episode explored President Trump’s executive order establishing English as the official language of the U.S., the historical scapegoating of Asian Americans, and the effects of mass deportations on immigrant communities. Grace also took a moment to reflect on the legacy of Tuyet Le, Advancing Justice | Chicago's former executive director, who passed away last month. 
We invite you to listen to Grace’s thoughtful and impactful interview! Here is the link: 
Immigration's Impact on Asian American Communities
 
 I Speak Power 
As the challenges of 2025 continue, ISP members and core leaders have remained focused on critical topics such as Know Your Rights/Know Your Power, Language Justice, and Immigration Justice.  During the holy month of Ramadan, many of our participants observe fasting and prayer, which has affected the scheduling of our weekly group meetings and workshops. However, we’ve stayed committed by offering individual sessions to each participant, allowing for personalized mentorship. Looking ahead, we are preparing for an immigration justice workshop set for April 5th.
KINETIC Updates
 
In March, KINETIC leaders hosted a workshop exploring the intersection of mutual aid and Know Your Rights (KYR) work. The event featured discussions on what mutual aid is—and what it is not—highlighting various examples of the practice both in Chicago and beyond. A central focus was how Know Your Rights initiatives align with the broader framework of mutual aid. 
After the workshop, KINETIC youth led a Know Your Rights canvass in Chinatown with ORIGIN, the Coalition for a Better Chinese American Community's youth group. Together, they talked to community members and local businesses about their experiences with immigration enforcement and distributed KYR materials in Chinese, English, and Spanish. 
Our April general meeting will be held on April 17th from 5:00–7:00 PM. Stay tuned for updates on social media and please email 
jwang@advancingjustice-chicago.org 
for the sign-up form. 
KINETIC is a space for Asian Pacific Islander Desi high school youth, including multi-racial folks, to build community with other progressive Asian American students and develop as youth leaders and organizers. Drawing on their lived experiences and learning through political education, KINETIC leaders will participate in and lead issue campaigns on policies impacting their communities. Youth can sign up through the interest form below.
KINETIC Interest Form!
 
A Just Chi Updates
In March, A Just Chi welcomed community organizer Zhang Mazi to facilitate “China: A Radical Re-Introduction.” Given ongoing US-China rivalry and the Trump administration’s new tariffs, this workshop offered timely insights and context. Zhang shared a brief history of modern China, answered common questions to provide a more nuanced understanding, and shared resources to help members think more critically about the US-China relationship.  
A Just Chi’s April General Meeting is on Wednesday, April 16th from 6-7:30. Please check our social media for updates! You can register at 
bit.ly/AJustChi2025
. 
 
A Just Chi is a space for Asian American grassroots activists, organizers, and volunteers. We have a general meeting every third Wednesday of the month for political education, workshops, moving our issue-based campaigns, and planning upcoming events. A Just Chi is specifically for Asian/Asian American community members, including multi-racial people. New folks are always welcome! 
 
Become a monthly donor!
  
Our March donor of the month is 
Desiree Bote
! Congratulations! You win a 10-pass gift certificate to any 
First Ascent
 location. Thank you for your continued support!  
Each month, Asian Americans Advancing Justice | Chicago selects a recurring donor for a special raffle prize. If you’d like a chance to win while supporting us, 
sign up to be a recurring donor today!
 
DONATE TODAY!

subject: [Expensify] Travel and expense, at the speed of chat
body:
tl;dr - Introducing Expensify Travel: fully managed corporate travel via web, app, or chat – now available to every Expensify member
 
Travel and expense should go hand in hand… and now they can! We've long been asked by customers big and small for the ability to: 
Book flights, hotels, rail, and car rentals from inside the app.
Limit what inventory employees see to only what is in the authorized travel policy.
Pay for these bookings using a central virtual card.
Capture the travel receipts into an automatic expense report.
Cut travel costs
In 
New Expensify
, press the green + button 
> Book travel
 (or in 
Expensify Classic
, click the 
Travel
 button along the left side of the screen). It does all the things you expect (in-policy booking results, travel-based spend analysis, out-of-policy notices, approvals before booking, duty-of-care reporting), plus a few tricks you don't – courtesy of the realtime chat framework of the New Expensify superapp: 
Realtime duty of care
, which lets you know where all your employees are at all times. We even connect the traveler and travel manager in a dedicated chat room to discuss all bookings and changes the instant they happen, rather than whenever you get around to checking your inbox.
Realtime expense management,
 where every booking receipt and change fee is recorded as an expense that's submitted up through Expensify's realtime approval and next-day reimbursement engine: book today, get paid tomorrow!
Realtime collaboration
, where shared trip chat rooms are automatically created in New Expensify so that everyone is on the same page. From employees to managers, everything you need to know about your trip, all in one place. 
The instant, chat-first design of New Expensify is why we like to say that Expensify does:
Travel and expense at the speed of chat.
To check it out, open your Expensify app and click 
Travel
, or take a peek below!
It's one of the most exciting times to be at Expensify that I can ever remember. We have a 
lot
 going on, and it's energizing to be sharing it with you after so long in development. Keep an eye out for a ton more on the way!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me in the 
#new-expensify-feedback
 room! 
PS: Check out OpenAI's work on building an 
artificial engineer
 to solve Expensify App open source projects!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103

subject: [Expensify] New for 2024: Budgets to keep your expenses in check
body:
You don't often get email from davidb@expensify.com. 
Learn why this is important
It's the season for reflecting on how last year went, and what can be done to make this year better.  One common refrain is asking "how did I end up spending so much on that?"  The answer is generally pretty simple: one small purchase at a time, with a steady trickle that added up faster than expected.  With that in mind, 
we're very happy to announce "tag and category budgets"
 – the easiest way to catch these financial leaks before they flood your basement.   
 
The feature works exactly as its name implies:
Edit an 
expense category or tag
 (like, "Travel expenses" or "Project X"). 
Pick a 
budget period
 (such as "monthly", or "yearly"). 
Assign a 
total workspace budget
, summed across all workspace members (in case you have multiple, though this works great for sole-proprietors with no employees as well). 
Assign a 
per-member budget
, to regulate each individual member's spend. 
Hit Save, and we'll let you know:
Whenever anyone spends over 50% (or whatever threshold you pick) of the budget for the first time this period. 
And again once the budget has been 100% used.
The notification is delivered via email, as well as in New Expensify to your workspace's #admins room, with a link taking you straight to the spend so you can update your forecast.  It's an easy solution to a hard problem, and you can set it up three different ways:
Ask your account manager to set up a call to walk you through it.
Read more about 
tag and category budgets online
. 
Or just hit 
edit
 on your favorite tag or category and set it up. 
As the old saying goes: 
The best time to 
plant a tree
 
create a budget was a long time ago.  The next best time is right now.  
 
Give budgets a shot and make 2024 your best year yet!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions?  Ask me on 
Twitter
 X! 
@dbarrett
 
PS: 
New Expensify
 is starting to get really good.  It's already great at settling friend-to-friend debts, splitting bills between groups of friends, and chatting in groups across platforms (Android, iOS, web, with both your email and SMS contacts).  But coming real soon here is full blown multi-organization enterprise chat and task management – not to mention a truly realtime take on financial collaboration inside and between companies.  2024 is going to be a big year for the Expensify community.  Get ready!

subject: [Expensify] Know any teachers? Let Expensify.org help them help their students
body:
tl;dr - 
Refer a K-12 teacher to Expensify.org
 so we can reimburse 50% of any purchase they make to help underprivileged students in their classrooms.
As fall begins, countless kids around the world have eagerly (or sullenly) returned to school. Many of them are very prepared. But not all are, and nobody is more qualified to know which kids need help than the teachers responsible for their care. One such teacher is Doug Bird, who thirty years ago (omg, how did I get so old) taught my drama class at Swan Valley High School (Go Vikings!) in Saginaw, Michigan. 
Doug (aka, Mr. Bird) had a huge impact upon my time in school, like countless millions of other teachers around the globe – and thirty years later, is still there, helping kids like me find their place in the world. But not all kids were as lucky as me, and able to show up to school with a backpack of books, a lunchbox of food, and the basic supplies to learn the basics of growing up in this world. 
That's why it is depressingly common for extraordinary teachers like Mr. Bird to dip into their own pockets to help out the students in their classroom who are less fortunate. This can be as simple as a blank notebook and a handful of markers, as serious as a pair of clean socks and a winter coat that fits, or as sad as 
paying off a kid's lunch debt
 so they can have possibly the only hot meal of their day. 
In fact, it's so common for teachers to spend their own money on the kids in their care, that here in the US the IRS has a special tax break just for teachers: the 
Educator Expense Deduction
. It allows teachers to deduct up to $250 from their income tax as thanks for helping their kids out. 
But it's not nearly enough
, and Expensify.org wants to help them help their students. 
You might have heard of New Expensify, our highly-simplified, chat-centric, from-scratch rewrite of Expensify Classic, that we've been working on for years as the foundation for the next generation of the product going forward. One feature of New Expensify is what we call, quite modestly, "Save The World". This isn't us saving the world. It's you saving the world. And the latest way you can do it, works like this: 
Click 
new.expensify.com/teachersunite
 and sign in (or if you're already signed into Expensify Classic, click the green chat bubble in the bottom-right).
Click the big green + button and choose 
Save The World
.
Click 
I know a teacher
.
Think of your favorite teacher. It could be someone who taught you, or someone who teaches your kids.
Enter their email address or phone number, and we'll take it from there.
Specifically, we will split their classroom bill with them in 3 steps:
They scan the receipt of the next purchase they make on behalf of their kids.
We will confirm with their principal (ie, their boss) that it was in fact for kids in their classroom.
We reimburse them 50% (up to $50) from donations made to Expensify.org.
 
It's really that simple: you invite the teacher, and we'll pay them to help their kids. There's no catch – it doesn't cost you or them anything. We've got the money (a slice of every Expensify Card purchase goes to Expensify.org via our 
Karma Points program
, in addition to our Corporate Karma and Personal Karma programs, as well as our network of incredible monthly donors – 
join today!
). We just need your help deciding who to give it to. 
So please take a moment to help us help your favorite teacher, so they can help the students in their classroom who need it the most. These problems shouldn't exist. But they do, and kids are suffering as a result. Let's give them a hand, and bit by bit, let's save this world together. 
Check out 
Expensify.org/teachersunite
 to learn more!
Thank you.
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on 
Twitter
 X! 
@dbarrett
 
PS: In case it wasn't already clear, Expensify.org is reimbursing teachers who are spending their own money, helping someone else's kids. These are true heroes, in every sense of the word. Accordingly, we feel very confident that the money is being well spent, because it's their money – we are only reimbursing half. Furthermore, we ask their principal (ie, their boss) to confirm every receipt is in fact going to help kids in their classroom, increasing our confidence further. This is the special and unique model of Expensify.org, which uses the power of modern expense management to laser target donor funds precisely to specific individuals in need, verified to the penny by receipt, and multiple layers of human review. 
PPS: To support the launch of Teachers Unite, we are sunsetting our SNAP campaign, which provided over $324,076.66 of groceries for over 6356 families since the onset of the pandemic. Though food insecurity is hardly a thing of the past, the pandemic thankfully is. Going forward we are moving away from emergency subsidies from Expensify.org to individual users, and towards campaigns like Teachers Unite that seek out and supercharge existing heroes who help people in need out of their own pockets. Expensify.org’s mission is to "empower individuals and communities to eliminate injustice around the world by making giving and volunteering more convenient, meaningful, and collaborative". This is an incredibly exciting transition for us, and we've got lots more ideas in store!

We're making some changes to our free teams offering in Canva, so we'd love to take a minute to explain what that means for you. 
As you've already joined a free team in Canva, we will make sure that you and your team can keep using it. However, there are some updates that you should know. 
Starting on October 31, 2023, adding new team members or replacing existing team members with new ones will require the team to upgrade to Canva for Teams.
 
You will still be able to use your free Canva team, including collaborating in real time with anyone else that you've shared your designs with, or who has shared designs with you.
You can learn more about this change 
here
.
Thanks for being part of the Canva community ❤️ 
Happy designing,
The Canva Team
 
 
  
 
You’re receiving this email because you have a Canva account. This email is not a marketing or promotional email. That is why this email does not contain an unsubscribe link. You will receive this email even if you have unsubscribed from Canva’s marketing emails.

subject: [Expensify] Analyze and control spend using Insights and Custom Reporting
body:
After a company adopts Expensify to get all their spend in one place, one of the most common questions we get is: how do I make sense of this? How do I analyze where my money is going, and spend it more efficiently? The answer is simple: click the new 
Insights
 button to get realtime, interactive spend analysis, right in your browser: 
 
Slice and dice your personal, employee, or company spend – across expense reports, corporate cards, invoices, and more – broken down as simple pie charts, or sophisticated time series. Check out 
the Insights help page
 to learn more – or even better: 
let your account manager do it for you
. Click 
Support > Account Manager
 (or ask in your 
#admins
 room), and we'd be happy to help with any of the following: 
Accrual Report
Aged Approval Reports
Attendee Reporting
Audit Report
Candidate Spend
Category Spend Report
Department/Project Spend Report
Duplication Report
Duty of Care
Efficiency
Employee Bank Account Status
Employee Details
Employee Roles
Expense Authorizations by Country
Expense Reports by Country
Expense Reports not posted to finance system
Foreign Currency Transaction
Fringe Benefit Tax Report
HR Report
Invoice Billed Transaction Reconciliation
Mileage Reports
Out of Pocket Expenses for Reimbursement
Per Diem Report
Reconciliation: Accounting, Bank Statement, Billed Transaction
Rejected Report
Travel Rule Class
Travel Spend
Unposted Cash Advance Report
Unposted Procurement Aging Report
Unposted Travel Aging Report
Vendor Spend
… or anything you can imagine.
So get reporting, whether on your own or with our help. It's all included in your base subscription, at no additional cost. Don't just manage expenses, manage spend by transforming realtime data into realtime insights to power your company forward! 
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on Twitter! 
@dbarrett

subject: Johnson & Johnson Account Statement Request -  JNJAA32000285501L
body:
Date:                            Tuesday, August 22, 2023
 
Subject:                        Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. –Vendor Account Review
 
 
Dear Valued Supplier,
 
 
Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. (paying agent for the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies) has enlisted the services of APEX Analytix, a third-party service provider, to review our vendor accounts with 
LANGUAGE AND CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
.  
 
To enable this review, Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. has authorized APEX Analytix to
·
      
Request and collect the suppliers’ current accounts receivable aging statements showing all open invoices and open credits for transactions such as returns, rebates, debits, unapplied cash, offsets, overpayments, unused deposits, pre-payments, etc. 
·
      
Perform a review of these statements and, 
·
      
Request refund payments on behalf of Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. and its subsidiaries, where applicable.
 
We therefore ask that you provide APEX Analytix your full cooperation in the event they have questions regarding your Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. account.  The information (which should be provided for the companies listed at the bottom of the email) will not be shared with other parties nor used for any other purpose. 
 
Please reply to 
RA-JJCUS-APStatement@its.jnj.com
 with reference 
JNJAA32000285501L
 included in the email subject.
 
 
Should APEX Analytix identify any payment errors that require you to return funds to Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. or any of its affiliates, we ask that you send a check for payment to our address below:
 
 
Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. 
c/o APEX Analytix 
P.O. Box 16571
New Brunswick, NJ 08906-6571
 
 
All checks 
must
 be made payable to “
Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc.
” and should include a reference to “
APEX
” on the check.
 
Any payments and refunds will be posted to your Johnson & Johnson Global Services vendor account.  
Note:  Current invoices and credit memos should continue to follow your current process as defined with Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. Global Services, Procurement.
To view your current account activity, you may visit our 
vendor portal at 
www.ap.jnj.com
.
 
If you have any questions or are not the correct contact, please reply to this email or contact Katherine Renew at 
krenew@its.jnj.com
 so that we may update our records.  
Your assistance in this review is greatly appreciated.
 
Sincerely,
 
 
 
Shemeika Peterkin
Requisition-to-Pay Compliance Specialist
Global Services, Procurement
8800 Grand Oak Circle, Tampa, Florida 33637

subject: [Expensify] Let our dedicated Account Managers expand your team
body:
tl;dr - Your accounting team just got bigger! Ask your dedicated account manager what they can do for you.
You have likely noticed that we are aiming to offer the absolute best customer support in the industry. We started with a product that is extremely simple to set up and run. Then we added an AI-powered chat Concierge that reliably responds in under 2 minutes and is available 24/7. Now we're very happy to add dedicated account managers you can get to know on a first name basis, to help complete whatever setup, reconfiguration, or ongoing management issue you might have. How do you get one?
If you have 10 or more active seats, odds are you already have one! Go to 
Settings > Policies
 and click 
Chat with Admins
 to be taken to the #admins chat room for your policy. Your account manager is already there and eager to talk to you via chat, or set up a call – whatever you prefer!
If you don't have 10 annual seats, go to 
Settings > Policies > Subscriptions
, choose 
Annual Subscription
, and then choose a 
Subscription Size
 of 10 or more. A dedicated account manager will reach out instantly.
What can your account manager do for you? Ask and find out! But some suggestions:
Price check.
 Are you using the right mix of annual and pay-per-use seats? Are you aware of how the Expensify Card can not only slash your bill, but possibly earn you more in cashback than the bill itself? Let us analyze your activity, bill, and spending patterns to make the best recommendation.
Health check.
 When's the last time you really took a look at your Expensify settings? Let us do a quick review of your latest requirements based on how your company has changed against the latest features in our toolbox, to find the perfect blend for you.
Change management.
 Are you thinking of switching accounting or HR systems? Switching banks (ahem, possibly in a hurry)? Adopting a corporate card program? Adding international entities? Let us know and we'll help you plan and execute a seamless migration. 
Note: Another feature coming along for the ride is "policy change logs" – now any change to key policy settings will be recorded in the #admins room for that policy, creating a historical audit trail of who changed what. This way if you ask your account manager to make a change for you, you'll see exactly what was done, when, and by whom.
Reporting.
 Need to download data as a CSV? Whip it into a PivotTable? Visualize it with pretty charts? Let us know your data dream, and we'll take care of it!
Compliance.
 Are you newly public or thinking about starting the journey? As a newly public company that just got SOX compliant, we feel that pain – let us alleviate it for you. Whether you're being audited to AICPA or PCAOB, SOC or SOX, we're in your corner.
Expensify is simple enough to be self-serviced, if you prefer (especially with our 
newly revamped help site
). But included in your base subscription is access to our award winning managed service, so you might as well take it for a spin!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on Twitter! 
@dbarrett
 
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103

subject: [Expensify] Pay anyone, anywhere, with FREE global reimbursements
body:
tl;dr - Withdraw from 24 countries, deposit to 200+ countries, 
without pre-funding
.
This has been a long, long time coming. I am incredibly happy to announce that Expensify is now a true global financial platform, and can support making payments from bank accounts in USD, CAD, GBP, EUR, and AUD to almost any bank account anywhere in the world. At no additional charge. It's real simple:
Click the "Support" button
 in the left-hand nav to talk with your dedicated Setup Specialist, Account Manager, or just straight to Concierge.
Say you want to set up "global reimbursements"
 and they'll walk you through the process (the exact setup flow, security checks, and underwriting model differs based on where you are withdrawing from and depositing to, so it's best done with our white-glove support service).
Scan receipts and import expenses as normal
 – in any currency you want. Everything about the expense reporting flow itself stays unchanged.
Reimburse the report
 just like you have been doing for years with USD reports. Non-USD reports are processed exactly like USD reports have always been.
We will withdraw from your 
existing
 USD, CAD, GBP, EUR, or AUD bank account
. You don't need to create a new bank account, or pre-fund a settlement account, or any of that junk – just connect your non-USD account in the same way you connected your USD account.
We will contact your employee
 to set up the deposit account, in whatever country they are located.
We will deposit into your employee's account
, wherever it might be in the world, just like we've been doing for USD reimbursements into US bank accounts.
And that's really it. I mean, there is an unbelievable amount of complexity behind the scenes to make that happen. But don't you worry about that; to you, it's as simple as can be.
And 
it doesn't cost you extra
. This is built into your base Collect or Control subscription. So go get global reimbursing, there's no reason to wait!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on Twitter! 
@dbarrett
 
PS - From now on, every time you bring a user into the platform who goes on to adopt an Expensify subscription, we will pay you $250 (
fine print
). Use your personal joining link below to refer users to Expensify and get rewarded: 
https://join.my.expensify.com/?thanks=zoe@lcwmail.com

subject: [Expensify] Get $250 when you refer someone to Expensify
body:
tl;dr referring someone to Expensify comes with a juicy reward, submit a receipt to your boss and get $250 when they adopt Expensify
Expensify was built by our users who love Expensify so much they tell their friends, colleagues, managers, and bosses to use it too. Word of mouth is the backbone of our business. We solve your need to transcribe receipts and input information into a spreadsheet. In return, many of you tell your friends and submit reports to a boss who ultimately adopts Expensify for the team. This is how we acquired more than 12 million users, and we are eternally grateful for that. The Expensify community would not be what it is today without our incredible champions out there. Now we want to flip the script and give you a little thank you for telling people about us.  
From now on, every time you bring a user into the platform who directly (or indirectly, more below) goes on to adopt Expensify, we will pay you $250. Use your personal joining link below to refer users to Expensify and get rewarded:
https://join.my.expensify.com/?thanks=zoe@lcwmail.com
There are terms and conditions to read and meet, but it’s basically as simple as that. 
Here’s how it works:
Share your referral link with friends and colleagues who are spending too much time on expenses, or who work at a business that could benefit from using Expensify.
Get $250 for any referred business that commits to an annual subscription and makes two monthly payments.
You can refer anyone working at any company you know. If their company goes on to become a customer of Expensify, you'll get paid. The best way to start is to submit a receipt to your boss (you'll get paid back and set yourself up for $250 if they start a subscription: win-win). You can read more about the referral program 
here
.
The world is crazy right now, not least for people in the tech industry, or those who are working on their business in general. As the most successful expense management tool in the market today, we’re seeing that every business, big and small, is working hard to track their expenses so they can keep growing despite a challenging market. If you know anyone using a tool that is not Expensify to manage expenses, it’s likely we can make their business more efficient and help with their spending. So while we have our wits about us, let’s help our peers weather the oncoming storm together.
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions?  Ask me on Twitter!  
@dbarrett

subject: [Expensify] Magic links make signing in faster, easier, and more secure
body:
Our goal is to make Expensify a little better every day in every way, and today's the day that we upgrade a very important flow: signing in.
tl;dr - Starting today, you don't need your password to sign in.  Instead, we send a "magic link" to your email/phone to confirm you are you, and you are let in with a click. This is a phased roll-out so some of you will see this change sooner than others.
This is called a "passwordless" signin flow, which is widely recognized by the security industry as being a much better balance of security and convenience than the traditional password, for the following reasons:
The only way to remember a different password for each service is to make each password super simple, which is easy for an attacker to crack.
The only way to make a password hard to crack is to make it hard to memorize, which means you generally share the same password between many services.  But then when one service is hacked, the attackers get access to all the others.
The only way to not share secure passwords between sites is to use a password manager to store them all, which makes them 
a lucrative target
.
The only way to protect against mass leak of all your passwords is to change them frequently but 
changing your password often is actually insecure too
.
No matter how you slice it, passwords are a bad solution to an important problem. It's been over a century since 
speakeasies stopped using passwords
 in the prohibition era 1920's, it's long past due we stop using them to secure our most important financial data.  So here's how Expensify's new signin process works:
Imagine you go to expensify.com, or install the Expensify app.
You enter your email address or phone number to sign in.
    a. Note: If your company uses SAML or SSO for signin (either of which might prompt you for a password), those keep working – you are unaffected.
A "magic link" will be emailed/texted to you – just click that link (or manually enter the "magic code"), and voila, you are signed in, quickly and securely, like magic!
    a. Note: If you've 
enabled two-factor authentication (2FA) using a "one time password" (OTP) authenticator
 – which is a mouthful, but it's actually very easy and we strongly recommend it – you'll be asked to enter your signin code after clicking the magic link.
Your app will stay signed in unless we need to re-confirm your access  (eg, if you change your account’s login email or phone number), at which time a new magic link will be sent to reauthenticate you.
It's a much better, safer, easier, and more convenient flow, and is fully rolled out for all accounts that formerly used Expensify passwords.  Other than just enjoying this new feature, you shouldn't need to do anything special.  However, it's probably a good time to:
Update your mobile app, to make sure it has the latest magic signin flow.
Review your Secondary Logins under 
Settings > Account > Account Details > Secondary Logins
 to ensure your logins listed are updated.
Secure your account through 
two-factor authentication (2FA)
This is just one of many, many layered defenses Expensify has to protect your account data and financial flows. That now includes PCI level 1 certification, the highest level of security for businesses that manage credit card data.  If you have any questions at all about this new way to secure your account, just respond to this email and we'll help you out.  Thanks!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions?  Ask me on Twitter!  
@dbarrett
 
PS: This is probably obvious, but just in case you are wondering why we care so much about security: Expensify isn't just a place you go to talk.  We process billions of real dollars.  Accordingly, securing your account means securing your 
Expensify Card
, your 
next day reimbursement 
flow, your 
invoiced income
 and 
bill payments
.  We are a single superapp that not only handles every financial flow for your business, but with our focus on Send/Request Money in 
New Expensify
, also your personal payments.  So I hope you'll take the security of your account as seriously as we do!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103

subject: [Expensify] Work like a boss in our San Francisco Lounge with complimentary cocktails, espresso, and more
body:
tl;dr - Whether you live in San Francisco or are just passing through, come work alongside other digital nomads at our brand new 
Expensify Lounge
! 
What: Indulge in 
fabulous espresso drinks, craft cocktails
, and astonishing views
Where: 16th floor of 
88 Kearny St
, San Francisco – in the heart of the financial district
When: 
Starting April 24th
, open M-F, 8 am to 6 pm
How: Just show up, sign in to wifi, and Concierge will 
deliver drinks to your seat
Capacity's limited, and we're currently admitting on a first-come-first-serve basis, so come early and stay for 
sunset champagne sabering
! 
Does your office look like this? Ours does! And yours can too, because our ufficio es su ufficio:
 
During COVID, we went through an amazing transformation from an office space to this lounge for any Expensify member to work out of as often as they like, with complimentary drinks of all kinds. 
Think of it like "high-end airport lounge" meets "co-working space", optimized for like-minded individuals -- coffee in the morning and cocktails at night (or the reverse, no judgment) -- built into your existing Expensify membership, for as low as $9/mo. 
Because Expensify isn't just a tool, it's a way of life. It's a community of people who want to GSD while living rich, having fun, and saving the world. Meet other members of the community in person, and not only is the first round on us, all of them are. 
If you’re in San Francisco, come on in! If you’re somewhere else, reply to this email with the city you live in to help us choose our next lounge location. 
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on Twitter! 
@dbarrett
 
PS: For a bit of backstory, we actually started this pre-COVID, in response to a strange problem. 
Though Expensify started in SF, we’ve been hiring outside of SF for over a decade, and decided to pay everyone SF wages, no matter where they lived. Bit by bit, our SF crew saw that you can succeed at Expensify from anywhere in the world, which led to people questioning if SF was the right place for them and their growing families. 
This diaspora was aggravated further by our super high employee retention (2/3rd have been here over 4 years and 20% of folks over 8), which means people grew and their lives changed while here. They got dogs, and spouses, and kids (generally in that order), and kind of concluded they'd had enough of the "San Francisco experience" -- and wanted to try the PDX, NYC, MEL, or LHR experience (where we have other locations), or dozens of other cities around the world, or just become digital nomads entirely. 
Slowly but inexorably, we saw attendance in our SF office drop, risking it becoming a very, very well-appointed ghostland. We asked ourselves: "How do we preserve the vibrancy of the office for those who do want to stay in SF?" To answer that question, we started looking at where those who left were going to -- and we realized they were by and large going to far flung locations, and then working out of cafes. 
Now, we already have a lot of experience with the WFC (Work From Cafe) lifestyle from our 
annual trips abroad as a company
. And we already knew firsthand that there was something magical about that tiny cafe in Hanoi that made it so much more fun to work from than even the best office in San Francisco. So after a lot of soul searching, we boiled it down to three main components: 
1) Great coffee.
 Not average coffee from some giant vat. Fresh ground, single-origin pour-over coffee. Freshly pulled espresso shots into a steamy cappuccino. Coffee so good you don't feel compelled to go to a coffee shop, because you are already in one. 
2) Great cocktails.
 We've got employees all over the world, so the sun never sets on the Expensify empire. But even when we were all in SF, the startup life doesn't end at sunset -- and at some point, you've just had too much coffee and want a change. Sometimes you want to code with a hand-mixed Old Fashioned by your side, kept cold by a giant ice cube. The Ballmer Peak is real. 
3) Great company. 
But not your company.
 The one thing a cafe has that your office doesn't, is someone you work beside, but not with. As social media lowers barriers to meeting people online, it raises them between us in person, and the cafe is the last bastion where you can credibly meet someone new -- to hear a new perspective or discover a new opportunity. 
Armed with these epiphanies, we did what anybody would do: turn our office into the best co-working cafe in the city. We added a ridiculously over-the-top cocktail bar like you'd find tucked away in a Tokyo highrise and put in an espresso bar even us Portland coffee snobs can respect. Then we paired it with our integrated chat Concierge to offer to-your-seat delivery, powered it with our New Expensify chat system, and then dialed up the overall furnishings to 11. 
And you're welcome to come work here. I guarantee it's better than your office, or any office, and it's designed to be a better place to work than any cafe in the city, too. 
But the open secret is that we didn't actually do it for you. We did it for us, to make our own lives better by having you in them. So if you come by, we don't say "thank you" to be polite. We mean it, we're glad to have you here. 
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103

subject: [Expensify] Meet George Clooney at ExpensiCon
body:
Every 
ExpensiCon
 has been hallmarked by a keynote discussion with an interesting customer – and given our tens of thousands of customers around the world, that gives us a lot of options.
The first customer we picked for the first ExpensiCon was Xero, represented by its then-CEO Rod Drury, who shared insights on how to build a multinational organization from the ground up and bring modern solutions to the SMB. The second customer was Bill.com, represented by its CEO Rene Lacerte, who talked about the need to balance your commitments to both your professional and personal life while being an effective leader.
This time around, our featured customer is the Clooney Foundation for Justice, represented by its co-founder, Oscar-winning actor & filmmaker 
George Clooney
.  As a recipient of the AFI Life Achievement Award, two Academy Awards, and the Nobel Peace Laureates’ Peace Summit Award – 
we can think of no single individual who better demonstrates our ideals of Living Rich, Having Fun, and Saving the World.
George's legendary career as a film star in iconic films such as the Oceans trilogy, O Brother, Where Art Thou? or (my personal favorite) Solaris requires no introduction.  And on top of it, his Casamigos Tequila quickly became a standard on top shelves worldwide. 
However, what excites me the most is to talk with George about his incredible advocacy for freedom, democracy, and human rights around the world.  In 2016, Amal and George established the Clooney Foundation for Justice to advance justice through accountability for human rights abuses around the world.  Whether defending women in unjust courtrooms, negotiating the release of detained journalists, or aiding those experiencing the horrible atrocity of violence, the Clooney Foundation for Justice is a powerful force for good that should inspire us all.
Regardless, as incredible as that will be, he is just one of many speakers covering a wide range of topics, from accounting to… something starting with Z.  Guests at ExpensiCon will mingle with speakers, and – more importantly – with the other guests, in breakout sessions, at dinner, over drinks, or in the pool.  There is truly no event like this in the world (and it doesn't come along often) so if you haven't already signed up, please head to 
ExpensiCon.com
 to register your interest today.  
It's all expenses paid
, so what have you got to lose?
I can't wait to see you there.
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions?  Ask me on Twitter!  
@dbarrett
 
PS: If you’re not already in the running to 
win your spot at ExpensiCon
 - there’s still time, so get started today! Five lucky winners will not only score an all-expenses paid trip (with a guest!) to ExpensiCon in Italy, they’ll also 
meet George Clooney 
at an exclusive VIP event! 
PPS: Not an ExpensifyApproved! Accountant yet?  No problem, it costs nothing and you get killer perks for your firm and clients. Some notable ones include:
Partner Manager - a dedicated point of contact for escalations, firmwide trainings, strategic goal planning, and new initiatives.
Client Setup Specialist - an onboarding expert to help accountants implement Expensify for their clients, configure accounting integrations, and more.
Client Account Manager - a day-to-day product specialist for any client questions that come up, with best practices in mind along the way.
Special client pricing - with no annual commitment, so your firm can adapt as new clients onboard or previous clients move everything in-house.
Get started 
here
. 
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103

subject: Tax Document from eShares, Inc
body:
Dear Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC,
Greetings from 
Tax1099.com
 ! 
Your 
1099-NEC
 was submitted by 
eShares, Inc
 for 
2022
.
 
Instructions for opening the form:
Click on the attachment provided with this email. You will be prompted for your password, which is 8 characters. Please enter the first 4 letters of the name listed after the word 'Dear...' at the beginning of this email, all lowercase, and the last 4 digits of the tax ID (either SSN/EIN or ITIN). 
For example:
 
1. If your name appears on the form as Andrew Johnson with an SSN of 711223456, then the password would be andr3456 (first 4 characters of your Full Name / Business Name + last 4 digits of your SSN/ITIN number).
2. If your business name appears on the form as 
A & D
 with ITIN as 012847934, then the password would be ad7934 (first 2 characters without spaces and special characters of your organization name + last 4 digits of your ITIN/EIN number).  
3. If your business name appears on the form as Andrew Johnson PLLC with ITIN as 012847934, then the password would be andr7934 (first 4 characters of your organization name + last 4 digits of your ITIN/EIN number). 
4. If your name appears on the form as Al & D with ITIN as 517223355, then the password would be ald3355 (first 3 characters (ignore special characters and spaces) of your Full Name / Business Name since the Full Name / Business Name is shorter than 4 characters + last 4 digits of your SSN/ITIN number).
5. If your name appears on the form as Andrew Johnson without an SSN/ITIN number, then the password would be andr (first 4 characters of your Full Name / Business Name). 
6. If your name appears on the form as Al & D without SSN/ITIN number, then the password would be ald (first 3 characters (ignore special characters and spaces) of your Full Name / Business Name since the Full Name / Business Name is shorter than 4 characters). 
7. If your name or business name appears on the form as My Test with TIN as 012847934, then the password would be myte7934 (first 4 characters of your name or organization name + last 4 digits of your TIN/EIN/SSN number). 
If you encounter any problem in opening your eForm, please check whether:
 
1.You have entered the first 4 characters of your name/organization name (in lowercase letters).
2.You have entered the last 4 digits of your SSN/ITIN/EIN number. 
After downloading, If this form's intended owner does not want the saved PDF file to keep the password requirement, please attempt the following PDF altering methods:
 
1.Open the PDF file using Adobe reader > After entering the PDF password for the first time you can disable it using adobe options.
2.Open the PDF in any browser > enter password > print > select the option to Save as PDF and the new PDF that is saved will not have the password. 
Depending on your personal spam filter settings, your eForms might be directed to your junk folder rather than Inbox. Please check in both places. If you have questions or need further assistance, please contact the Payer 
eShares, Inc
 at Phone #
(801) 471-4608
 or ap@carta.com. 
Thanks for your business. 
 
*DO NOT REPLY TO THIS E-MAIL MESSAGE*

tax1099.com 
All Rights Reserved.

subject: Upcoming Webinar and Giveaway: Hiring, Firing & Promotion with Psychological Safety
body:
As an HR leader you have to make a lot of the tough calls, and we don’t envy you. During this live virtual event we’ll take you through some of the nuances of psychological safety as it relates to your role.
 
 
As an HR leader you have to make a lot of the tough calls. We don’t envy you, but we’re here to help. During this live virtual event we’ll take you through the basics (and some of the nuances) of psychological safety as it relates to your role:
Can you really know who will help or hurt your company culture from just an interview?
Is psychological safety a big enough deal to cause someone to lose their job?
Should cultural impact be considered in the promotion process?
These are the kinds of tough questions we’ll answer during the event on Thursday, November 17th at 12pm EST. Stay tuned.
Register For the Event
 
 
In the meantime, do you want a free license to our online course? Or the chance to win a free signed copy of The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety? Share this event and invite 500 of your LinkedIn connections to attend and we’ll get you set up. That's $100 of value in under five minutes.
Let's Do It
 
 
Back by popular demand is another special episode talking about engagement and psychological safety. Tim and Junior talk about which is a lead measure, which is a lag measure, and which is a consequence of the other. This episode comes from a previous webinar recorded in 2021.
Listen Now
 
 
 
 
 
 
LeaderFactor, Suite C, Alpine, UT 84004, USA

subject: [Newsletter] What is Challenger Safety?
body:
Do you invite others to disagree with you? These kinds of questions will help you diagnose the levels of challenger safety in your organization.
 
 
What is Challenger Safety? 
 
Challenger safety is psychological safety's culminating stage. It's where innovation takes off and team members feel the full effects of inclusion, respect, and autonomy.
 
When was the last time you challenged the status quo in your organization?Are questions welcome on your team? Do you feel the risk of ridicule on your team? Do you invite others to disagree with you? These kinds of questions will help you diagnose the levels of challenger safety in your organization.
Learn More
 
 
What does it take to innovate on dynamic teams? At the end of the day, a lack of innovation is a culture issue, and knowing that is a game-changer. A culture-changer, if you will. Our hosts share their practical tips on how to do just that, and more, in this value-packed series finale.
Listen Now
 
Don't Let Hierarchy Stifle Innovation
 
Many non-management employees consider innovation outside the scope of their jobs. Even when they want to participate, they don’t because the organization’s tacit norms discourage it. In this Harvard Business Review article, Tim Clark gives three practical steps to neutralize authority bias, embrace cultural flatness, and unleash bottom-up innovation.
Read the Full Article
 
 
In this episode of Culture by Design, Tim gives listeners behind-the-scenes insights into the theory behind his recent HBR article, Don't Let Hierarchy Stifle Innovation.
Listen Now

subject: [Newsletter] Contributor Safety: 4 Models to Shape Your Thinking
body:
Can you create value on your team? Without contributor safety, your teams will execute more than they innovate. Give them the autonomy they crave with these simple suggestions.
 
 
What is Contributor Safety?
 
 
There’s a reason why we’ve automated so many monotonous workplace tasks as technology has advanced: Humans crave fulfillment, and work is meaningful when we can create value, not just complete tasks. Contributor safety, the third stage in The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety, protects our innate desire to do just that. 
 
Sometimes we get in our own way. Sometimes we get in each other’s way.
Learn More
 
 
On this week's episode of the Culture by Design podcast, Tim and Junior continue the series with Stage 3: Contributor Safety. They ask the question, why do we hate being micromanaged? And what does that have to do with psychological safety?
Listen Now

subject: [Newsletter] What is Learner Safety?
body:
When you don’t have it, your team executes more than they innovate. They stay stagnant and lose their competitive advantage. 
 
 
What is Learner Safety? 
 
It's a culture where learning is encouraged and celebrated, and where learners are protected in their efforts to push boundaries. When you don’t have it, mistakes are hidden and punished. Your team executes more than they innovate. They stay stagnant and lose their competitive advantage.
Learn More
 
 
On this week's episode of the Culture by Design podcast, Tim and Junior tackle some tough, relevant questions for learners and leaders everywhere: How do you detach fear from mistakes? How do you appropriately reward failure?
Listen Now
 
The Secret to Building Trust in Teams
 
Trust = Psychological Safety + Consistency. Don’t expect perfect, shatterproof trust to immediately come from day one of your culture initiative. 
Trust builds across an organization when psychological safety is met with consistency. 
How could you ever expect a culture of trust to come from toxicity? 
Read the Full Article
 
 
In this episode of Culture by Design, Jeri Larsen shares her tips and tricks for being an aggressive, self-directed learner. Turns out, you can't do it alone.
Listen Now
 
5 Behaviors That Foster Learner Safety
 
Sure, we can talk about it, but how do you really make sure your teams know that they're safe to learn? We've got your back. Check these out. 
Download This Note

subject: [Newsletter] What is Inclusion Safety?
body:
Psychological safety can't happen without a foundation of inclusion. How can you expect people to try new things, speak up, and spark change if they don't feel safe being their authentic selves at work?
 
 
What is Inclusion Safety? 
 
Psychological safety can't happen without a foundation of inclusion. How can you expect people to try new things, speak up, and spark change if they don't feel safe being their authentic selves at work? Once people feel confident that they belong on their team, they'll be ready to progress across The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety™. 
Learn More
 
 
This week on the Culture by Design podcast, Tim and Junior introduce the first episode of a four-part series on The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety. This week's topic? Stage One: Inclusion Safety. In this value-packed, hour-long conversation, Tim and Junior dive deep into questions like: How does inclusion relate to diversity and equity? Is interaction the same thing as connection? And what can we do to foster inclusion safety in our cultural spheres? 
 
Listen to this episode of the 
Culture by Design Podcast,
 "
Stage One: Inclusion Safety
" available on all channels. 
Listen Now
 
 
In this episode of Culture by Design, Chantal le Roux, Inclusion, Diversity and Equity Program Manager at Amazon Web Services joins Timothy R. Clark to talk about how to embed inclusive strategy into workplace culture. It’s core business, something that people need to take ownership of in order to create spaces that are truly psychologically safe.
Listen Now
 
 
Psychological Safety at Work
Do you know if your organization has psychological safety? Learn which warning signs to look out for and best practices for measuring it on your teams.
Read the Full Article
 
 
Building Connection in a Remote Team
 
With intentional effort, your remote team can feel just as connected as an in-office team. Here are some LeaderFactor tried-and-true methods of remote connection:

subject: [Newsletter] Does My Organization Have Psychological Safety?
body:
The tools you need to uncover the pockets of toxicity in your organization, put words to what's wrong, and find out whether your teams need to increase their levels of psychological safety.
 
 
Does Your Organization Have Psychological Safety? 
 
Sometimes it's hard to tell. Over time we become numb to the pains and discomfort of punished vulnerability and forget what it feels like to live without fear at work. But it doesn't have to be that way. In this week's newsletter we'll give you the tools you need to put words to what's wrong, uncover the pockets of toxicity in your organization, and find out whether your teams need to increase their levels of psychological safety.
What is Psychological Safety?
 
 
In this week’s episode of the Culture by Design podcast, Timothy R. Clark is joined by Melody Wilding, author of 
Trust Yourself: Stop Overthinking and Channel Your Emotions for Success at Work. 
As an executive coach, professor of Human Behavior, licensed social worker, and Harvard Business Review contributor, Melody has lots to say about how burnout, ambition, sensitivity and empathy.
 
Listen to this episode of the 
Culture by Design Podcast,
 "
Invest in Your Well-Being
" available on all channels. 
Listen Now
 
 
In a previous episode of the Culture by Design podcast, Dr. Timothy R. Clark invites Nicki Eyre to talk about navigating workplace bullying from both the individual and organizational level, why encouraging a speak-up culture is not enough, and how to have both performance and cultural accountability for individual contributors and leaders.
 
Listen to this episode of the 
Culture by Design Podcast,
 "Navigating Workplace Bullying" available on all channels. 
Listen Now
 
 
Is Your Boss Actively Toxic
or Passively Complicit?
Although we expect it to be obvious, most toxic behavior is subtle. Subtlety is safer than blatant toxicity because it gives the perpetrator deniability. If we were to give you a menu of subtle behaviors it might include: 
 
1. Ignoring a question
2. Neglecting a visible need
3. Holding back feedback deliberately to maintain ambiguity
4. Withholding time and attention
5. Excluding someone from a meeting or conversation
6. Piling on the work under the guise of mock appreciation.
 
Keep reading to learn how you can identify your leader's tendencies, because teams and organizations don’t outperform their bosses, they reflect them. That’s why sources of toxicity must be identified and either removed or coached.
Read the Full Article
 
 
How to Spot a Toxic Culture in a Job Interview
 
One of the hardest questions you can ask an interviewer is: "Can you tell me about your organization's culture?" They may give you vague answers about pizza parties and casual Fridays, a scripted response that is less-than-believable, or may not know how to answer the question at all. The last thing you want is to accept a job without knowing anything about the culture you're walking into. In this LeaderFactor Note we give you nine questions to help you spot a toxic culture before you sign the contract:
Download This Note
 
Measure Psychological Safety with
The 4 Stages™ Team Survey
  
 
Even with all of these self-diagnosing tools we shared today, it's hard to know how your teams are actually doing. I mean, we call them hidden problems for a reason, right?
 
Other engagement surveys that try to account for psychological safety will fail to give you a concrete plan for action and will leave you wondering what’s next. There’s no other organizational survey in the world that will give you insight into your organization’s pockets of rewarded and punished vulnerability than The 4 Stages™ Team Survey.
Learn More
 
 
“Diversity is a matter of makeup and composition. Inclusion is a matter of belief and behavior.”
 
–  Timothy R. Clark
